alert.note: Alert for Boone; Clay; Kanawha; Lincoln; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 4:33PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Kanawha, east central Lincoln, southern Roane, west central Clay and north central Boone Counties through 500 PM EST... At 432 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sissonville, or near Charleston, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Sissonville, Chesapeake, Marmet, Belle, Clendenin, Cedar Grove, East Bank, Cross Lanes, Pinch, Alum Creek, Institute, Coal Fork, Elkview, Amma and Sod. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 32. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 117. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 48 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 83 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 62 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.
